de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder

Class AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType extends HeaderDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, which is created by the builder
    BuilderType - The type of the builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractValidateableDialogBuilder, WizardDialog.Builder

    public abstract class AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType extends HeaderDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType,?>>
extends AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
    An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain a header.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder(Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain a header.
      AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder(Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain a header.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder

        public AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder(@NonNull
                                   Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain a header.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder

        public AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder(@NonNull
                                   Context context,
                                   @StyleRes
                                   int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain a header.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

    • Method Detail

      • showHeader

        public final BuilderType showHeader(boolean show)
        Sets, whether the header of the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be shown, or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True, if the header of the dialog should be shown, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType
